sch:rule.sch:assert: Document SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] header-level templateId such that the templateId contains exactly one [1..1] @root=”1.2.208.184.13.1”

Document SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] header-level code.
This code SHALL specify the Questionnaire Response Document generated by patient in response to a Questionnaire Form Definition document containing a specific measure.
The document code SHALL be a code from the LOINC Document Ontology which indicates a Questionnaire Response document containing responses to questions asked from the patient.
SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] confidentialityCode, which SHALL be selected from ValueSet HL7 BasicConfidentialityKind 2.16.840.1.113883.1.11.16926 STATIC. This code SHALL always be set to “N”.
patientRole SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] id.
patientRole SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] patient, where birthTime SHALL be precise to month
patientRole SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] patient, where birthTime SHALL be precise to day
patientRole SHALL contain exactly one [1..1] patient, where birthTime hhMMSS and offset from UTC SHALL be set to “000000+0000”.
There SHALL be exactly one assignedAuthor/assignedPerson.

sch:assert.test: (v3:representedOrganization and not(v3:assignedPerson) and v3:id[@nullFlavor='NA']) or (v3:assignedPerson and v3:representedOrganization) or (v3:assignedPerson and not(v3:representedOrganization)) or (not(v3:assignedPerson) and not(v3:representedOrganization))

sch:rule.sch:assert: If assignedAuthor has an associated representedOrganization and no assignedPerson, then the value for "ClinicalDocument/author/assignedAuthor/id/@NullFlavor" SHALL be "NA" "Not applicable" 2.16.840.1.113883.5.1008 NullFlavor STATIC.
Patient generated Questionnaire Response Document in DK Realm SHOULD conform to the DK Realm Generated Document Header template (templateId: 1.2.208.184.13.1.1.1).
